recipes.name: Regular Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a muffin tin or line with paper liners.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, combine the milk, vegetable oil, egg, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in any optional ingredients such as blueberries, chocolate chips, or nuts.
Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Let the muffins cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.
In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in the boiling water. The batter will be thin, but that’s okay.
Pour the batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove them from the pans and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Frost with your favorite chocolate frosting and serve.

recipes.name: Sardine Sandwich
instructions: Drain the canned sardines and remove any bones if desired.
In a bowl, mix the sardines with mayonnaise and lemon juice.
Add salt and black pepper to taste.
Toast the bread slices if desired.
Spread the sardine mixture evenly on one slice of bread.
Place lettuce and tomato slices on top of the sardine mixture.
Cover with the second slice of bread.
Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

recipes.name: Beef Jerky
instructions: Freeze the beef for about 1-2 hours until firm but not frozen solid. This makes it easier to slice.
Slice the beef against the grain into 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick strips.
In a large resealable plastic bag, combine soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, brown sugar, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper flakes, and kosher salt.
Add the beef strips to the marinade, seal the bag, and shake to coat the beef evenly. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or overnight for best results.
Preheat your oven to 175°F (80°C). Line baking sheets with aluminum foil and place wire racks on top.
Arrange the beef strips on the racks in a single layer, making sure they do not overlap.
Bake in the preheated oven until the jerky is dry and firm yet slightly pliable when bent, about 3-4 hours. Check occasionally to avoid over-drying.
Remove from the oven and let cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

recipes.name: Fried Rice
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the diced onion and carrot, and cook for 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften.
Add the peas and minced garlic, and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until fully cooked, then mix them with the vegetables.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to the skillet. Add the cooked rice and stir to combine with the vegetable and egg mixture.
Pour the soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice, and stir to coat the rice evenly.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice is heated through.
Remove from heat and stir in the sliced green onions.
Serve hot and enjoy your fried rice.
